education.studyType: Master in Artificial Intelligence - M2 AIC
courses: Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Image & Signal Processing, Probabilistic Graphical Models, Reinforcement Learning
Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering Science, Industrial Management

work.name: DGDDI (French Customs)
work.summary: Deploying machine learning models and web apps for fraud and financial anomaly detection.
highlights: Understanding and adapting ideas from research papers.
Developed and deployed continuously data web apps (Git CI/CD and version controlling) working with agile methodology.
Did full stack development: from data preparation (Spark), database architecture (SQL, MongoDB), AI model (Python), back-end (Flask API) and front-end (Angular, html, css)

work.name: DATA&DATA
work.summary: Developing AI products for online distribution tracking and grey market monitoring in the luxury industry
highlights: Winner of the LVMH Innovation Award 2021 in the category “Data & AI”
Developed conjointly with the CEO the company from scratch: from 0 to 20 clients in the luxury sector (LVMH, Richemont, AP, Hermès) with a 100% client retention rate for 3 years.
Worked on multiple BI products (grey market, price monitoring, store locator) incorporating NLP and computer vision used mainly to identify luxury products such as watches, cosmetics, leathergoods.
Conducted dashboards demos, technical support and reporting to the client
Built a pre-owned watch quotation app for Audemars Piguet
Created an in-house web scraper able to collect any kind of data on more than 1000 websites
Follow-up and training of a small team of data scientist interns

work.name: Fortia Financial Solutions
highlights: Defined new features of “Innova” software (AI automated tool for compliance in Investment Banking)
Involved in demos & workshops to sell the solution and demonstrate use cases with client's data (BNP, SG)

skills.name: Python (Poetry, Pandas, Dask, Polars, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Pytorch, Keras, Networkx, Hugging Face, NLTK, OpenCV, Transformers, RAG, LLM), SQL/NoSQL, Linux, Cloud (Azure, AWS), Jobs Scheduling (Cron, Airflow), BI Tools (PowerBI, Streamlit), Webscraping (Selenium, Proxy), Spark, Container (Docker, Kubernetes understanding), Javascript, Typescript, Bash, Jira, Notion

interests.name: Mobile app development for group events

projects.name: Tradee
projects.summary: Developing a cryptocurrency trading tool using Deep Q-Learning and Binance API (model training, backtesting & trading)

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).
